answers.answer: Hello,Frequent urination in adults can be due to many causes. The primary cause which needs to be excluded is diabetes. I would advise you to get a fasting blood sugar and Hb A1 C test done.If diabetes is ruled out then other possibilities which need to be ruled out are prostatitis(inflammation of the prostate gland),interstitial cystitis,overactive bladder syndrome,stroke and other neurological diseases,urinary incontinence,bladder cancer(rare) and bladder dysfunction .Please consult a urologist in that case. I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: Hi,I am male, 38 years, and  having higher urine frequency(say every 30-60 minute) for a very long time.I have 2-4 times taken blood/urine/suger tests, but each report came normal.Then the Urologist told me to take Urotel-XL 4, once a day.It gave me 60-70% relief, but not permanent.Any suggestion..??Thanks
title: Urine frequency higher
